content.title: Practice knowledge test
content.failingResultsBody: A passing score of 80% is required on the real test.
content.message: Need to study before your knowledge test? Check out the Learn to Drive Smart Manual.

question.text: Black signs with white arrows indicate

answers.answer: which way you may go in your lane.
answers.distractor_1: which way you may go at an intersection.
answers.distractor_3: information about local roads and distances.

answers.answer: A lower speed limit ahead.
answers.distractor_1: This speed limit is ending.
answers.distractor_2: The maximum speed you are currently allowed to travel.
answers.distractor_3: No turns for the next 50 kilometers.

answers.answer: Keep right of the divider.
answers.distractor_1: Divided highway ends.

answers.answer: Indicates a pedestrian crosswalk.
answers.distractor_1: Indicates a school crosswalk.
answers.distractor_3: Warns of people on the road.

answers.answer: The curb lane of the cross street ahead is a reserved lane.
answers.distractor_1: There is an extended sidewalk at the intersection.
answers.distractor_2: Buses turning right must merge from the lane with the diamond shape.

answers.answer: Winding road ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Road may be slippery ahead.
answers.distractor_3: The road ahead crosses over a river.

answers.answer: Roundabout ahead.
answers.distractor_1: U-turns ahead.

answers.answer: School crosswalk ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Children on road.

answers.answer: The recommended exit speed - drive slower in poor conditions.
answers.distractor_1: Slow down to this speed if you are being passed.
answers.distractor_2: Slow down to this speed to allow other drivers to exit the highway.
answers.distractor_3: All traffic must slow down to this speed.

answers.answer: An obstruction - keep left or right.
answers.distractor_1: You must go in the direction of the lighted arrow.
answers.distractor_2: Dead end street - turn left or right.

answers.answer: You must go in the direction of the lighted arrow.
answers.distractor_1: You may go to the left or the right.
answers.distractor_2: Dead end street - turn left or right.

question.text: This flashing red 'X' in this light indicates:

answers.answer: Do not drive in this lane.
answers.distractor_1: Stop as you would as a stop sign.
answers.distractor_2: Bridge ahead is closed to allow ships to pass.

answers.answer: You may drive in this lane.
answers.distractor_1: Pedestrian controlled traffic light.
answers.distractor_2: Be prepared for the light to turn yellow.

question.text: A traffic light showing a flashing green arrow with a steady green light indicates:

answers.answer: You may turn in the direction of the arrow or proceed through.
answers.distractor_1: You may turn left but yield to oncoming traffic.
answers.distractor_2: You may merge into the left hand lane.
answers.distractor_3: You may turn left on to a one way street.

question.text: This steady green light with a solid yellow arrow indicates:

answers.answer: The protected left turn signal is about to change and oncoming traffic will be facing a steady green light.
answers.distractor_1: You should speed up slightly to ensure you make it through the light.
answers.distractor_2: You will not be allowed to turn left at this intersection until the arrow re-appears.
answers.distractor_3: All traffic must slow down and stop unless you can not safely stop in time.

question.text: A single yellow broken line indicates:

answers.answer: Traffic moving in opposite directions - passing is allowed when safe.
answers.distractor_1: Two lanes of traffic moving in the same direction - changing lanes is allowed when safe.
answers.distractor_3: No turns allowed across the broken line.

question.text: A broken yellow line along with a solid yellow line indicates:

answers.answer: You may pass if the broken line is on your side and only when it is safe.
answers.distractor_1: Vehicles travelling in both directions may pass when safe.
answers.distractor_2: You may pass if the solid line is on your side and only when it is safe.

question.text: A solid single yellow line indicates:

answers.answer: Passing allowed with extra caution.
answers.distractor_1: No passing is allowed.
answers.distractor_3: A bicycle lane to the right.

question.text: The white line in this diagram indicates:

answers.answer: A stop line - stop before this line.
answers.distractor_1: A speed bump - slow down in this area.
answers.distractor_2: Watch for children on the road.
answers.distractor_3: No parking past the white line.

question.text: These white lines across a road indicate:

answers.answer: A crosswalk.
answers.distractor_1: Where you must stop before the intersection.

question.text: When you see flashing yellow lights in the road by these white lines:

answers.answer: It indicates a pedestrian activated crosswalk - stop for pedestrians in the crosswalk.
answers.distractor_1: Stop as you would at a stop sign.
answers.distractor_2: Be prepared for the flashing lights to turn red.
answers.distractor_3: It indicates a pedestrian activated crosswalk - you must stop before the crosswalk.

question.text: This diamond shape road marking means:

answers.answer: Reserved lane - additional markings will indicate which vehicles are allowed.
answers.distractor_1: Bus lane only - all other vehicles are prohibited.
answers.distractor_2: Emergency vehicles only - do not block lane.

question.text: The marking on the right of the road ahead indicates:

answers.answer: A bicycle lane for cyclists only.
answers.distractor_1: Vehicles may not use lane if bicyclists present.
answers.distractor_3: Cyclist crossing area - be prepared to stop.

answers.answer: Vehicles in this lane must turn left.
answers.distractor_1: U-turn ahead.

question.text: Road markings. These yellow markings on the road mean:

answers.answer: Painted Island - keep to the right and do not drive on or over the markings.
answers.distractor_1: Two way left turn lane - move into the yellow area to turn.
answers.distractor_2: Extended left turn lane - you may drive over the markings if rest of left lane full.
answers.distractor_3: Emergency pullout area - pull over to the yellow area and display hazard lights.

answers.answer: Sharp curve to the right ahead - slow down.
answers.distractor_1: Intersection ahead - slow down.
answers.distractor_2: Right turn only at this intersection.
answers.distractor_3: Obstruction ahead - slow down and move to the right.

answers.answer: Merging traffic ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Two lanes reduced to one lane ahead.
answers.distractor_2: Yield to all traffic on the right.

answers.answer: Right lane ends ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Divided highway ends.

answers.answer: Obstruction - keep right.
answers.distractor_1: Obstruction - keep left or right.

answers.answer: Yield the right of way to other traffic.
answers.distractor_1: Stop as you would at a stop sign.

answers.answer: Do not enter.
answers.distractor_1: One way street.
answers.distractor_2: Stop, as you would at a stop sign.

answers.answer: Pedestrian controlled crosswalk - if light is flashing be prepared to stop.
answers.distractor_1: Pedestrian controlled crosswalk - if light is steady yellow you may proceed.
answers.distractor_2: Pedestrian crosswalk - stop as you would at a stop sign.
answers.distractor_3: School zone - stop if lights flashing.

question.text: When must you observe this speed limit?

answers.answer: 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. on regular school days.
answers.distractor_1: Dawn to dusk every day.
answers.distractor_2: Whenever children are on the road.
answers.distractor_3: Every weekday from dawn to dusk.

answers.answer: Two way left turn lane.
answers.distractor_1: Left and right turns allowed at this intersection.
answers.distractor_3: Left turns only at this intersection.

answers.answer: No right turn at this intersection.
answers.distractor_1: No right turn from this lane.
answers.distractor_2: Left turn only at this intersection.

answers.answer: No left turn at this intersection.
answers.distractor_1: The lane ends ahead - turn left.
answers.distractor_2: Do not move into the left lane.
answers.distractor_3: Left turn only at this intersection.

answers.answer: No turns permitted at this intersection.
answers.distractor_1: Yield to traffic in intersection.

answers.answer: Trucks may be crossing ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Trucks slow down - slippery road ahead.

answers.answer: Hidden intersection or side road ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Truck crossing ahead.

answers.answer: Hazard ahead, slow down and turn right or left.
answers.distractor_1: Park on either the left or the right.

answers.answer: The road may be slippery when wet.
answers.distractor_1: The road is winding.
answers.distractor_2: Watch for oil slicks on road.
answers.distractor_3: Skidding likely in this area at all times.

question.text: This sign means slow to 30 km/h:

answers.answer: Every day from dawn to dusk.
answers.distractor_1: Weekdays from dawn to dusk.
answers.distractor_2: When you see children on road.

answers.answer: Playground nearby - drive with caution
answers.distractor_1: Sports stadium nearby - watch for hazards.
answers.distractor_2: Slow to 30 km/h if pedestrians crossing.

answers.answer: The pavement ends ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Road construction ahead.

answers.answer: There is road construction ahead.
answers.distractor_1: The end of a construction zone.
answers.distractor_2: The start of a construction zone - you must obey the traffic control person.

answers.answer: Obey this speed limit at all times throughout the construction zone.
answers.distractor_1: Obey this speed limit when the construction crew is working.
answers.distractor_2: Crew and equipment are working and you must obey the speed sign from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
answers.distractor_3: You must obey the speed sign on weekdays.

answers.answer: Stop and proceed when it is safe to do so.
answers.distractor_1: Slow down and proceed through intersection if safe.
answers.distractor_2: Stop until the light changes to a flashing green light.
answers.distractor_3: Stop until the light changes to a flashing yellow light.

answers.answer: You may turn in the direction of the arrow if the intersection is clear.
answers.distractor_1: You may turn in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
answers.distractor_2: The cross-street is a one way street in the direction of the arrow.
answers.distractor_3: You may only turn left at this intersection.

answers.answer: Stop. After coming to a full stop you may turn right or turn left onto a one-way street unless a sign forbids it.
answers.distractor_1: Stop if traffic is approaching.
answers.distractor_3: You must stop unless you are turning right.

answers.answer: You may proceed if the intersection is clear.
answers.distractor_1: Turns are allowed at this intersection.
answers.distractor_2: Slow down and proceed with caution.
answers.distractor_3: You may drive in this lane.

question.text: A flashing yellow traffic light means:

answers.answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop.
answers.distractor_1: The light is about to change to red.
answers.distractor_3: The light is about to change to green.

answers.answer: The traffic signals are controlled by pedestrians.
answers.distractor_1: The light is about to change to red.
answers.distractor_2: Opposing traffic is facing a red light.
answers.distractor_3: You may drive in the lane below the light.

question.text: A flashing green arrow with a steady red light means:

answers.answer: You may turn left.
answers.distractor_1: No left turn at any time.
answers.distractor_2: The cross-street is a one way street in the direction of the arrow.
answers.distractor_3: Wait until the red light turns green before turning left.

question.text: The centre lane in this diagram:

answers.answer: Is shared by vehicles travelling in opposite direction when making left turns.
answers.distractor_1: May be used to stop to answer your cell phone.
answers.distractor_2: May be used for emergency vehicles only.
answers.distractor_3: Indicates an intersection with a turn ahead.

answers.answer: Stop unless it is unsafe to do so.
answers.distractor_1: Slow down but proceed.
answers.distractor_3: Stop only if there are other vehicles in the intersection.

answers.answer: One-way traffic.
answers.distractor_1: Traffic straight through only.

answers.answer: Narrow structure ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Two lanes merging.

answers.answer: Watch for fallen rock or landslide obstructing traffic.
answers.distractor_1: Construction blasting zone ahead.

answers.answer: You are approaching a slow moving vehicle.
answers.distractor_1: Yield the right of way.
answers.distractor_2: You are approaching a disabled vehicle by the side of the road.
answers.distractor_3: You are in a construction zone.

answers.answer: Underpass (or structure) ahead. Overhead clearance as shown.
answers.distractor_1: Road narrows to 3.8 metres.
answers.distractor_2: No turns for the next 3.8 miles.
answers.distractor_3: No vehicles above this height allowed on road.

answers.answer: Divided highway ends ahead - keep right.
answers.distractor_1: Divided highway start - keep right.

question.text: A square or rectangular sign with a white background:

answers.answer: Shows driving regulations.
answers.distractor_1: Warns of hazards ahead.

question.text: Diamond-shaped signs with a YELLOW background:

answers.answer: Warn of hazards ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Show driving regulations.
answers.distractor_3: Warn of a school zone ahead.

question.text: Diamond-shaped signs with an ORANGE background:

answers.answer: Warn of construction zones.
answers.distractor_1: Show driving regulations.

answers.answer: Shows a permitted action.
answers.distractor_1: Shows an action that is not permitted.

answers.answer: Vehicles in both lanes must turn left.
answers.distractor_1: There is a curve to the left ahead.
answers.distractor_2: Keep to the left of the divider.
answers.distractor_3: Both lanes curve to the left ahead.

question.text: This signal with a steady green arrow means:

answers.answer: No turn permitted - go straight through only.
answers.distractor_1: Drive in this lane only.

answers.answer: Bumps or rough road ahead - slow down.
answers.distractor_1: Industrial area ahead.

question.text: The signal above this solid red light means:

answers.answer: Only buses may go on this signal.
answers.distractor_1: Public transit buses may not proceed.
answers.distractor_2: All traffic must stop - emergency vehicles approaching.
answers.distractor_3: Yield to public transit buses - then proceed.

answers.answer: Cyclists may be on roadway.
answers.distractor_1: Bicycle lane ahead.

answers.answer: Do not pass.
answers.distractor_1: There is only single lane traffic ahead.
answers.distractor_2: The road is for one way traffic only.
answers.distractor_3: There is a divided road ahead.

answers.answer: Only buses and high occupancy vehicles in this lane.
answers.distractor_1: Only buses in this lane.
answers.distractor_2: Area for buses and taxis only.

answers.answer: The fastest you may drive under ideal conditions.
answers.distractor_1: That there is a faster speed limit ahead.
answers.distractor_2: The ideal speed for this road in any condition.
answers.distractor_3: The maximum speed unless you are passing.

question.text: This signal over a lane means:

answers.answer: Move out of this lane and into the lane with the green arrow.
answers.distractor_1: Do not drive in this lane.
answers.distractor_3: This lane is about to open.

answers.answer: Obstruction - keep left.
answers.distractor_1: Obstruction ahead - keep right.

answers.answer: Railway crossing ahead - be prepared to stop.
answers.distractor_1: There are no warning lights.
answers.distractor_2: You may drive straight across the railway crossing.
answers.distractor_3: The railway crossing is no longer in use.

answers.answer: Road narrows ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Divided highway ends ahead.

answers.answer: School crosswalk, yield to pedestrians; if there is a crossing guard follow directions.
answers.distractor_1: Pedestrian crosswalk.

answers.answer: School bus stop ahead.
answers.distractor_1: An oncoming vehicle has its lights flashing.
answers.distractor_2: A vehicle ahead has its hazard lights flashing.
answers.distractor_3: A fire truck zone is ahead.

question.text: This sign, without a speed tab below, means:

answers.answer: School zone - reduce speed when children are present.
answers.distractor_1: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
answers.distractor_3: You must be prepared to stop at crosswalks controlled by crossing guards.

answers.answer: Steep hill ahead - slow or gear down.
answers.distractor_1: Runaway vehicle lane ahead.

answers.answer: Stop sign ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Proceed from this stop sign.
answers.distractor_2: Be ready to stop ahead if necessary.

question.text: This sign means that in this lane, you must:

answers.answer: Turn left only.
answers.distractor_1: Turn left or go straight ahead.

answers.answer: Two-way traffic ahead.
answers.distractor_1: Divided highway ahead.

answers.answer: Stop completely - continue only when safe.
answers.distractor_1: Stop or slow down if turning right.
answers.distractor_3: Slow down and stop if necessary.
